thread.title_full: Two NFL stars pull out of organized Israel trip after pro-Palestinian activists say delegation is aimed at using ... - Daily Mail

title: Two NFL stars pull out of organized Israel trip after pro-Palestinian activists say delegation is aimed at using ... - Daily Mail
text: show ad Two NFL stars pull out of organized Israel trip after pro-Palestinian activists say delegation is aimed at using them as propaganda tools Earlier this week, a news report indicated that 12 current and former NFL players were due to make a trip to Israel sanctioned by the government When word of the trip was made public, a left-leaning magazine wrote an open letter signed by prominent activists urging the players not to go Two of the players, Seattle Seahawks defensive end Michael Bennett and Miami Dolphins wide receiver Kenny Stills, responded that they would not be going Bennett wrote a letter stating that he would go to Israel in the future as well as take trips to Palestinian areas, including the West Bank and Gaza Strip For decades, Israel has been accused of human rights violations against the Palestinians after conquering territories in the 1967 Six-Day War Published: 01:31 GMT, 12 February 2017 | Updated: 01:58 GMT, 12 February 2017 5 shares
